name: Eugene
cooked: Sorry, I think I’ve conflated TCP reassembly with IP reassembly. When the bitcoind node was syncing, I was seeing reassembled TCP segments. I don’t think the IP fragmentation stuff applies here as I think most routers don’t fragment IP packets. However, the limit @tnull pointed out still applies as TCP will break up packets into MTU size chunks to transmit as IP packets.
